Join us in the Tasting Room for a tasting flight and a delicious Spring inspired menu this Easter weekend at Early Mountain. Enjoy your choice of a family style meal or a la carte options. For the former, we request that you pre-reserve before completing your reservation and do so before April 10th. ‚Å†
‚Å†
The Family Style Menu features exquisite savory dishes and concludes with Strawberry Rhubarb Pie and Brown Butter Ice Cream. View the full menu offerings and make your Easter weekend reservations with the link in bio. ‚Å†
‚Å†
@anna_kariel‚Å†

Chef's seasonal Meadow menu marks the beginning of picnic season. Slow down and take in the beauty of spring with a refreshing flight of wines and Chef's elegant take on classic picnic fare.‚Å† The Meadow menu offers small plates, sandwiches, and shareables that pair beautifully with our newly released wines and sunshine. The Pimento Grilled Cheese is better than Grandma‚Äôs, and that‚Äôs no joke! 

The Meadow is open to furry friends and walk-ins Friday to Sunday from 11 am to 5:30 pm starting (today) April 1st. ‚Å†
‚Å†
For those seeking our Virginia Table experience, reservations strongly suggested for both indoor and patio seating. Link in bio for reservations and full menu offerings. ‚Å†

‚ú®New Release ‚ú®‚Å†
‚Å†
Maya's 2022 International Women's Day Pick.‚Å†
‚Å†
2021 Soif is as easy on the palate as its name suggests. A thirst-quenching chillable red with snappy red and black fruit flavors. This vintage has a bit more density, color, and tannin than the 2020 vintage, allowing some of the more savory flavors to linger a little longer. A light-bodied red that shines on warmer Virginia afternoons. ‚Å†

Ros√© season is finally here, and we're drinking in every moment. 

Have you tried the 2021 Ros√© yet? This year's wine has a deeper color and texture, but the acidity still cleanses the palate, leaving a feeling of freshness and energy that will perfectly match your weekend plans. ‚Å†

‚Å†
@oh_sowhit @dxnoelle @prttykay ‚ú®

As the vineyard begins to awaken with the spring sun the winemaking team are hard at work in the cellar blending. While we love bringing expressions of specific sites to bottle (ie Quaker Run Chardonnay) blending brings the artistry to so many of our bottlings. Whether the kiss of Petit Manseng in Foothills or the complexity of structure built in RISE, Ben and Maya work together to blend wines that both reflect the vintage and express the essence of each wine. ‚Å†üç∑‚ú®

And the Gold goes to‚Ä¶‚Å†
Our inaugural release of Petit Verdot joins perennial favorite Eluvium in winning Gold at this year's Governor's Cup competition.üèÜ

Celebrating its 40th anniversary the Virginia Governor's Cup is one of the most stringent competitions in the US. We love this celebration of Virginia Wine and congratulate all the winners!‚Å†

‚ú® Spring Release ‚ú®‚Å†

The 2021 Ros√© brings the much-anticipated escape to warmer days. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Strawberries, white peaches, and red grapefruit drive the aromas of the 2021 Ros√©. A few notable changes were made this year, adding more early-picked Merlot to the blend and using Malbec and Petit Verdot to drive color and acidity leaving a feeling of freshness and energy. The wine is layered with flavor, but no single note‚Å† demands the spotlight, instead, they operate in harmony, bringing a feeling of poise and completeness. The citrus tones take a leading role, edging the berry character to the side just a touch in this ‚Äúclassic‚Äù style, fresh, energetic, pure Ros√©.‚Å†
‚Å†
Early Mountain 2021 Ros√© - Now available for your enjoyment. 
‚Å†

We are enjoying some beautiful spring-like weather at the winery this week. The green is starting to pop up over the hills again, giving us hope for the brilliant spring ahead. ‚Å†

Mark your calendars for a special long weekend celebrating the bounty of the Eastern Seaboard at Early Mountain, from Thursday, March 3rd - Monday, March 7th. ‚Å†ü•Çü¶™
‚Å†
Chef Tim Moore has crafted a delicious seafood menu and Big Island Aquaculture will be shucking their oysters, served on the half shell direct from the beautiful, pristine body of water nestled between the York River and the Mobjack Bay in Hayes, Virginia. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Enjoy fresh oysters with live music (Sat. and Sun.), mountain views, and delicious seafood wines from throughout the Commonwealth. Choice of Tasting Room (indoor) or Patio reservations are available (pending weather). ‚Å†
‚Å†
No entrance fee, reservations are strongly recommended.‚Å†
Reserve your table, link in bio.

We have exciting news for Virginia wine lovers! The Taste Of Virginia Wine Club just opened new enrollment slots and there are only 40 spots left for 2022. If you LOVE Virginia wine and the idea of having access to the hardest-to-find gems the TOV is the perfect fit, made for explorers who like to experience multiple wineries rather than commit to just one. You will have access to some of the rarest, small-batch wines from wineries pushing the envelope and driving quality in Virginia. ‚Å†

üç∑Two releases per year (April and October), 6 unique bottles each release. Due to legal restrictions, we only ship to VA, DC, CA, FL, SC.‚Å†

The upcoming April shipment includes the following:‚Å†

‚ú® Early Mountain Petit Manseng Demi-Sec 2020‚Å†. Sweet-tart expression of our favorite grape.‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ú®Rosemont Vineyards Extra Brut Sparkling Ros√© NV‚Å†. Bone dry Ros√© bubbles. ‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ú®Cana Vineyards Ros√© of Cabernet Franc 2021‚Å†. Inaugural release. Small batch bottling from one of Virginia‚Äôs Ros√© specialists.‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ú®Stinson Vineyards Meritage Blanc 2020 ‚Å†
Inaugural release. Celebration of Rachel & Nathan‚Äôs daughter.‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ú®Vino del Bosco Cabernet Franc 2021 ‚Å†
Fruit-led, juicy expression of this aromatic grape.‚Å†
‚Å†
‚ú®Barboursville Vineyards Reserve Merlot 2014‚Å†. Library release from one of Virginia‚Äôs favorite wineries‚Å†.
